1. Run Foldit on your computer. Foldit is available for free at http://fold.it. Once the game is running, start a science puzzle and navigate to social, then click on remote connection. In the corresponding dialog box click 'Turn on' to open up a port on your machine.
2. If needed, allow Foldit through your firewall.
3. Connect this device to the same network as your desktop (at home on the same wireless network for example) OR port forward if you are connecting through a router and want to access Foldit from outside your network.
4. If you are on the same local network, type in the local IP address that Foldit tells you. If you are connecting through a router with port forwarding, use your public IP address.
5. Press connect, you should now see the game on your screen. For additional help, please visit the Foldit forums.

Ctrl and Shift toggles are in the upper left corner of the screen. If you want to click and use something, such as dragging a sidechain, first click on it to highlight it, then click, wait, and drag. Pinch to zoom in or out (works on scrolling lists too). Use two fingers to move the protein around the screen. If your game is running slowly, try switching to lower resolution in the settings.\n

Is remote connection turned on in your Foldit game? (Under Social, Remote Connection). Is Foldit unblocked in your firewall? (In Windows, go to the control panel, then firewall, then 'Allow a Program or Feature through firewall'. Is your desktop connected to the internet? Is your Android device on the same network, or have you port forwarded? Are both your desktop and Android applications up to date? For more help, visit the Foldit forums.
